            COST SHARING,TF037712-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR INVES,TF037227-ETHIOPIA - HEALTH SECTOR,TF036579-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM,TF036573-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM,TF036241-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM,TF036146-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR INVESTMENT,TF036054-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR
            DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM,TF035551-ETHIOPIA - EDUCATION SECTOR
            INVESTMENT PROGRAM

abstracts.cdata!:
The first five-year phase of the
            Education Sector Development Project, an expenditure program
            to restructure and expand Ethiopia's educational
            system, improves overall educational attainment while
            achieving greater social equity. The project has six
            components. Basic education, the first, builds, upgrades,
            and renovates new primary schools, reforms curriculum,
            upgrades teachers, and increases textbooks in order to
            increase access and enrollment--especially in rural areas,
            improve teacher quality and school proximity. It uses
            non-formal education and radio programs. The second
            component expands secondary schools, revises curriculum,
            upgrades teachers, and increases instructional materials and
            equipment. The third component consists of technical and
            vocational education and training activities that encourage
            private sector participation in order to tie training to the
            job market, increase the availability of skilled labor, and
            raise the employment rate. The fourth component upgrades and
            expands teacher training institutes and colleges and uses
            distance learning. The fifth component expands higher
            education by encouraging private sector investment and
            designing cost-sharing schemes to meet the country's
            needs for educators, engineers, health workers, and public
            administrators. The sixth component, institutional
            development, improves planning, finance management, and
            implementation, monitoring, and evaluation capacities of the
            education ministries and agencies.
